pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:0.5: 4. The training rule on memorizing the Teaching
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were instructing lay followers to memorize the Teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.3: Those lay followers became disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.4: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.5: “How can the monks from the group of six instruct lay followers to memorize the Teaching,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.6: those lay followers becoming disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward the monks?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.7: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.12: “… Foolish men, how can you instruct lay followers to memorize the Teaching,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.13: those lay followers becoming disrespectful, undeferential, and rude toward the monks?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it or increase the confidence of those who have it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:1.16.1: ‘If a monk instructs a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.5: A person who is not fully ordained:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.6: anyone except a fully ordained monk and a fully ordained nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.8: a line, the next line, syllable by syllable, the next phrase.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.10: they start together and finish together.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.12: one of them starts, but they finish together.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.14: when ‘_rūpaṁ aniccaṁ_’ is being said, he prompts him, saying, ‘_rū_.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.16: when ‘_Rūpaṁ aniccaṁ_,’ is being said, the other says, ‘_Vedanā aniccā_.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.17: And whatever line there is, whatever next line, whatever syllable by syllable, whatever next phrase—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.20: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by disciples, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.22: if he instructs by the line, then for every line he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.1.23: If he instructs by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.1: If the person is not fully ordained, and the monk does not perceive them as such, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.2: If the person is not fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.3: If the person is not fully ordained, but the monk perceives them as such, and he instructs them to memorize the Teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.4: If the person is fully ordained, but the monk does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.5: If the person is fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.2.6: If the person is fully ordained, and the monk perceives them such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.4: if he prompts one who is speaking a mostly familiar text;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.5: if he prompts one who is reciting;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.8: The fourth rule, the training rule on memorizing the Teaching, is finished.
